pr_body:
As part of my GSOC project https://github.com/synfig/synfig/issues/3017, I wanted to write documentation explaining the Rendering Code. My goal is to make it easier for new developers to understand the rendering code. I am not explaining functions, I am explaining the concepts, the trickier parts and how they are used together.

Pages:
- [x] Introduction
- [x] Target and Surface
- [x] Layers and Tasks
- [x] Render Engine and Queue
- [x] Optimizers

pr_body:
This PR aims to enable split optimizer and fix all the issues that comes with it. Adds a experimental renderer option.

Known Problems:
- [ ] Contour rendering overlaps at split borders
- [ ] Sometimes TaskPixelProcessor tasks result in crash, see `clamp.cpp` line 135
- [ ] Some differences reported by image magick but not noticeable. https://github.com/synfig/synfig/blob/a3091aeeacf527495b2ab3cdc0d0796652747d89/synfig-core/src/synfig/rendering/surface.h#L250 might be related. I am using https://github.com/BharatSahlot/synfig_test to test.

Benefits:
- Improved rendering speed. Improvement depends on the file, in some files its not much but in some files like eye example, the render time is reduced by 10-13secs on my laptop.

Nice to do:
- Configurable Pixel rendering limit
- Configurable tile size

pr_body: Results in a small speedup of 100-200ms on most example files in 1080p. Sometimes the speedup is more visible like for eye example, the speedup was of 3secs.

[{'comment_id': 1241288125, 'comment_body': 'Is it faster passing by value instead of by reference (it should be by const reference, actually)?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 6, 25, 21, 6, 15, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rodolforg', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1241288280, 'comment_body': 'prefer this style:

```c++
if (fabsf(a) > COLOR_EPSILON) {
```

(space before parenthesis and curly bracket in the same line)', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 6, 25, 21, 7, 57, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rodolforg', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1242066367, 'comment_body': "Yes its faster to pass by value in this case. It isnt const ref because the colors are actually changed but the changed colors are not used where this function is called, so ref doesn't serve a purpose.
I tried switch instead of vtable but it was slower for some reason.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 6, 26, 11, 43, 12, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BharatSahlot', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1242066858, 'comment_body': 'Okay, will keep in mind and make the change.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 6, 26, 11, 43, 36, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BharatSahlot', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1243533704, 'comment_body': 'Oh, indeed! Great catch!', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 6, 27, 10, 43, 39, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rodolforg', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1248774685, 'comment_body': 'Any updates?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 1, 11, 20, 2, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rodolforg', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1248777856, 'comment_body': 'Sorry, I was working on the opengl thing and forgot about this change. Will make it today and push.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 1, 11, 25, 34, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BharatSahlot', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_body:
This is part of my GSOC23 project Performance Optimization https://github.com/synfig/synfig/issues/3017 .

My goal isn't to write the most optimized OpenGL renderer but to set up a base and write basic tasks. We can optimize it later.

I would appreciate any help with testing. I am only testing on my laptop using [synfig_test](https://github.com/BharatSahlot/synfig_test).

Tasks Progress:
- [x] ColorPixelMatrix
- [x] Blend
- [x] Blur
- [ ] Task Transformation Affine (paused)
- [x] Task Pixel Gamma
- [ ] Task Contour
- [x] Chroma Key
- [x] Luma key
- [ ] Clamp
- [ ] Transformation Perspective
- [ ] Checker Board
